intro: Hieracium nanniscophorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium nanniscophorum is often found in open meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
